BUSINESS </B></FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AMR Corporation (AMR Company) incorporated October&nbsp;1982. AMR's operations fall airline industry. AMR's principal subsidiary, American Airlines,&nbsp;Inc., founded 1934. On April&nbsp;9, 2001, American Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. (through wholly owned subsidiary, TWA Airlines LLC (TWA LLC)) purchased substantially assets assumed liabilities Trans World Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. (TWA), eighth largest U.S. carrier. American Airlines,&nbsp;Inc., including TWA LLC (collectively, American), largest scheduled passenger airline world. At end 2002, American provided scheduled jet service 152 destinations North America, Caribbean, Latin America, Europe Pacific. American largest scheduled air freight carriers world, providing wide range freight mail services shippers system. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, AMR Eagle Holding Corporation (AMR Eagle), wholly-owned subsidiary AMR, owns regional airlines business "American Eagle"&#151;American Eagle Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. Executive Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. (Executive) (collectively American Eagle carriers). In addition, American contracts independently owned regional airlines business "AmericanConnection" (the AmericanConnection carriers). The American Eagle carriers AmericanConnection carriers provide connecting service American's high-traffic cities smaller markets United States, Canada, Bahamas Caribbean. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AMR Investment Services,&nbsp;Inc. (AMR Investment), wholly-owned subsidiary AMR, responsible investment oversight assets AMR's defined benefit defined contribution plans, short-term investments. It serves manager American AAdvantage Funds, family mutual funds institutional retail shareholders, customized fixed income portfolio management services. As December&nbsp;31, 2002, AMR Investment responsible management approximately $29.6&nbsp;billion assets, including direct management approximately $17.0&nbsp;billion short-term fixed income investments. The Company actively pursuing sale AMR Investment. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2><B><U>A. Recent Events</U> </B></FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The past years large impact Company's finances. The Company incurred aggregate operating losses $3.3&nbsp;billion $2.5&nbsp;billion years ended December&nbsp;31, 2002 2001, respectively. These losses reflect, things, substantial decrease Company's revenues began early 2001. On reduced capacity events September&nbsp;11, 2001, Company's revenues year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002 8.8&nbsp;percent, American's revenue seat mile 7.2&nbsp;percent capacity decrease 1.4&nbsp;percent, compared year ended December&nbsp;31, 2001, included results TWA LLC beginning April&nbsp;10, 2001. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2><U>Revenues</U> </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This revenue decrease driven number factors, Company believes persist indefinitely permanently, including: </FONT></P> <UL> <DL compact> <DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>A steep fall-off demand air travel, business travel,</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> primarily caused continuing weakness U.S. economy growing travel substitutes audio, video, web conferencing. Other Events</U> </B></FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;While Company recovering terrorist attacks September&nbsp;11, 2001, American Airlines flight 587 crashed November&nbsp;12, 2001, shortly take-off John F. Kennedy International Airport en route Santo Domingo Dominican Republic. In addition loss lives board aircraft, fatalities injuries persons ground property damage. The National Transportation Safety Board investigating accident determined. As result accident, claims filed American. It anticipated claims covered American's insurance policy. </FONT></P> <P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P> <HR NOSHADE> <!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=5,EFW="2108197",CP="AMR CORP.",DN="1",CHK=967539,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK014:[03DFW9.03DFW1349]DE1349A.;15',USER='LHOUSE',CD='14-APR-2003;19:39' --> <A NAME="page_de1349_1_5"> </A> <P><FONT SIZE=2><B><U>C. Competition</U> </B></FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The domestic airline industry fiercely competitive. Currently, air carrier deemed fit U.S. Department Transportation (DOT) free operate scheduled passenger service points U.S. possessions. On domestic non-stop routes, Company faces competing service one, one, major domestic airline including: Alaska Airlines, America West Airlines, Continental Airlines (Continental), Delta, Northwest Airlines (Northwest), Southwest Airlines, United US Airways, affiliated regional carriers. Competition greater cities require connection, major airlines compete respective hubs. The Company competes national, regional, all-cargo charter carriers and, shorter segments, ground transportation. On routes, pricing decisions affected, large part, competition airlines. On 80&nbsp;percent domestic routes, Company competes airlines cost structures significantly lower Company's operate profitably lower fare levels. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The airline industry characterized substantial price competition. Fare discounting competitors historically negative effect Company's financial results Company generally required match competitors' fares maintain passenger traffic. During recent years, number LCCs entered domestic market major airlines, including Company, implemented efforts lower cost structures. In addition, air carriers sought reorganize Chapter 11 United States Bankruptcy Code, including United US Airways. (Effective March&nbsp;31, 2003, US Airways emerged Chapter 11 restructuring.) Successful completion reorganizations resulted result significantly lower operating costs reorganized carriers derived labor, supply, financing contracts renegotiated protection Bankruptcy Code. Historically, air carriers involved reorganizations undertaken substantial fare discounting order maintain cash flows enhance customer loyalty. Further fare reductions, domestic international, occur future. If fare reductions offset increases passenger traffic, mix traffic improve yields and/or cost reductions, Company's operating results negatively impacted. As discussed Part&nbsp;A Item 1, Company stated survival assured labor costs lowered significantly. See Part&nbsp;E Item 1. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Most major air carriers developed hub-and-spoke systems schedule patterns effort maximize revenue potential service. American operates hubs: Dallas/Fort Worth (DFW), Chicago O'Hare, Miami, St. Louis San Juan, Puerto Rico. Delta Air Lines (Delta) United Air Lines (United) hub operations DFW Chicago O'Hare, respectively. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The American Eagle carriers increase number markets Company serves providing connections American American's hubs major airports. The American Eagle carriers serve smaller markets Boston, DFW, Chicago, Miami, San Juan, Los Angeles, Raleigh Durham New York's LaGuardia John F. Kennedy International Airports. The AmericanConnection carriers provide connecting service American St. Louis. American's competitors marketing agreements regional carriers provide similar services major hubs. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition extensive domestic service, Company international service Caribbean, Bahamas, Canada, Latin America, Europe Pacific. The Company's operating revenues foreign operations approximately 28&nbsp;percent Company's total operating revenues 2002 2001 30&nbsp;percent Company's total operating revenues 2000. Additional information Company's foreign operations included Note&nbsp;16 consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P> <P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P> <HR NOSHADE> <!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=6,EFW="2108197",CP="AMR CORP.",DN="1",CHK=479678,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK014:[03DFW9.03DFW1349]DE1349A.;15',USER='LHOUSE',CD='14-APR-2003;19:39' --> <A NAME="page_de1349_1_6"> </A> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The majority tickets travel American American Eagle sold travel agents. On March&nbsp;18, 2002, American announced longer pay base commissions tickets issued travel agents United States, Puerto Rico, Canada. As discussed Item 3 Legal Proceedings, Company subject legal challenges related changes. Previously, domestic travel agents generally received base commission percent price tickets sold, capped maximum $20 domestic roundtrip itinerary $100 international roundtrip itinerary. American continues, however, pay commissions travel agents connection special revenue programs. American believes carriers longer pay base commissions tickets issued travel agents pay commissions connection special revenue programs. Accordingly, airlines compete respect price tickets sold respect amount special revenue program commissions paid. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The growing electronic distribution systems Company opportunity lower distribution costs. However, continuous increase pricing transparency resulting Internet enabled cost-conscious customers easily obtain lowest fare route. The Company continues expand capabilities Internet website&#151;AA.com&#151;and electronic ticketing Company's network. In addition, Company, United, Continental, Delta Northwest, owns interest Orbitz, travel planning website. Orbitz online access airline, hotel, car rental travel services. The Company marketing agreements internet travel services. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;International air transportation subject extensive government regulation. In providing international air transportation, Company competes foreign investor-owned carriers, state-owned carriers U.S. airlines granted authority provide scheduled passenger cargo service U.S. overseas locations. The Company's operating authority markets subject aviation agreements U.S. respective countries, cases, fares schedules require approval U.S. Department Transportation (DOT) and/or relevant foreign governments. Because international air transportation governed bilateral agreements U.S. foreign country countries involved, U.S. foreign government aviation policies result alteration termination agreements, diminish route authorities, adversely affect Company's international operations. Bilateral agreements U.S. foreign countries served Company subject renegotiation. In addition, foreign airports, air carrier slots (landing take-off authorizations) air carrier introduce service increase existing service. The ATSA required checked baggage screened December&nbsp;31, 2002. The TSA assumed passenger screening functions February&nbsp;2002, largely contracting private-sector security providers. The Company's relations labor organizations governed Railway Labor Act. Under act, collective bargaining agreements Company organizations generally expire amendable stated date. If party wishes modify terms agreement, notify party manner agreement. After receipt notice, parties meet direct negotiations, agreement reached, party request National Mediation Board (NMB) appoint federal mediator. If agreement reached mediation, NMB declare time impasse exists, impasse declared, NMB proffers binding arbitration parties. Either party decline submit arbitration. If arbitration rejected party, 30-day "cooling off" period commences. During period (or after), Presidential Emergency Board (PEB) established, examines parties' positions recommends solution. The PEB process lasts 30&nbsp;days "cooling off" period 30&nbsp;days. At end "cooling off" period, agreement reached action Congress, labor organization strike airline resort "self-help", including imposition proposed amendments hiring workers replace strikers. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;American reached contract Association Professional Flight Attendants (APFA) 2001. MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION ANALYSIS FINANCIAL CONDITION RESULTS OPERATIONS </B></FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AMR Corporation (AMR Company) incorporated October&nbsp;1982. AMR's principal subsidiary, American Airlines,&nbsp;Inc., founded 1934. On April&nbsp;9, 2001, Trans World Airlines LLC (TWA LLC, wholly owned subsidiary American Airlines,&nbsp;Inc.) purchased substantially assets assumed liabilities Trans World Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. (TWA). Accordingly, operating results TWA LLC included accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002 2001 results TWA LLC included period April&nbsp;10, 2001 December&nbsp;31, 2001. All references American Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. include operations TWA LLC April&nbsp;10, 2001 (collectively, American) (see Note&nbsp;17 consolidated financial statements). American largest scheduled passenger airline world. In addition, AMR Eagle Holding Corporation (AMR Eagle), wholly owned subsidiary AMR, owns regional airlines business "American Eagle". AMR's operations fall airline industry. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2><B><U>Results Operations</U> </B></FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AMR's net loss 2002 $3.5&nbsp;billion, $22.57 share. AMR's net loss 2001 $1.8&nbsp;billion, $11.43 share. The Company's 2002 results include one-time, non-cash charge record cumulative effect change accounting, effective January&nbsp;1, 2002, $988&nbsp;million, $6.35 share, write-off AMR's goodwill adoption Statement Financial Accounting Standards Board No.&nbsp;142 "Goodwill Other Intangible Assets" (see Note&nbsp;4 consolidated financial statements). The Company's 2002 results adversely impacted continued economic slowdown residual effects September&nbsp;11, 2001 terrorist attacks discussed Part&nbsp;A Item 1. For discussion events September&nbsp;11, 2001, Note&nbsp;3 consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2><B>REVENUES </B></FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>2002 Compared 2001</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Although traffic continued increase reduced capacity events September&nbsp;11, 2001, Company's 2002 revenues yields materially year-over-year. In addition residual effects September&nbsp;11, Company's revenues continue negatively impacted economic slowdown, largely business travel declines business traveler profiles; geographic distribution Company's network; reduced fares due part increased competition low-cost carriers. The Company's revenues decreased approximately $1.7&nbsp;billion, 8.8&nbsp;percent, $17.3&nbsp;billion. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;American's passenger revenues decreased 8.5&nbsp;percent, $1.3&nbsp;billion, $14.4&nbsp;billion. System wide, passenger revenue yield passenger mile decreased 9.3&nbsp;percent, 1.22 cents, 11.86 cents, driving American's revenue seat mile (RASM) 7.2&nbsp;percent, .65 cents, 8.39 cents. In 2002, American derived approximately 70&nbsp;percent passenger revenues domestic operations approximately 30&nbsp;percent international operations. American's domestic RASM decreased 8.8&nbsp;percent, 8.26 cents, capacity decrease 1&nbsp;percent 125&nbsp;billion seat miles (ASMs). International RASM decreased 8.72 cents, 2.8&nbsp;percent, capacity decrease 7.2&nbsp;percent 47&nbsp;billion ASMs.&nbsp;The decrease international RASM due 7.1&nbsp;percent decrease Latin American RASM, offset 6.5&nbsp;percent 0.3&nbsp;percent increase Pacific European RASM, respectively. The decrease international capacity due 22.4&nbsp;percent, 7.9&nbsp;percent 3.3&nbsp;percent reduction Pacific, European Latin American ASMs, respectively. AMR Eagle's passenger revenues decreased $46&nbsp;million, 3.3&nbsp;percent, $1.3&nbsp;billion. AMR Eagle's traffic increased 11&nbsp;percent, 409&nbsp;million revenue passenger miles (RPMs), 4.1&nbsp;billion RPMs, capacity increased 1.9&nbsp;percent, 121&nbsp;million ASMs, 6.6&nbsp;billion ASMs.&nbsp;Similar American, decrease AMR Eagle's revenues due primarily continued impact September&nbsp;11, 2001 terrorist attacks economic slowdown. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cargo revenues decreased 15.3&nbsp;percent, $101&nbsp;million, $561&nbsp;million primarily due economic slowdown significant restrictions cargo shipments security reasons. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other revenues decreased 15.5&nbsp;percent, $177&nbsp;million, $966&nbsp;million due primarily decreases contract maintenance work American performs airlines, decreases codeshare revenue employee travel service charges. </FONT></P> <P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>27</FONT></P> <HR NOSHADE> <!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=28,EFW="2108197",CP="AMR CORP.",DN="1",CHK=744105,FOLIO='27',FILE='DISK014:[03DFW9.03DFW1349]DG1349A.;8',USER='LHOUSE',CD='14-APR-2003;20:17' --> <A NAME="page_dg1349_1_28"> </A> <P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>2001 Compared 2000</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company's 2001 revenues, yield, RPMs&nbsp;and ASMs&nbsp;were severely impacted September&nbsp;11, 2001 terrorist attacks, Company's reduced operating schedule, worsening U.S. economy dampening demand travel domestically internationally prior September&nbsp;11, 2001 events, business travel declines result September&nbsp;11, 2001 attacks, increased fare sale activity occurring subsequent September&nbsp;11 attacks encourage passengers resume flying. Although Labor Agreements enabled Company avoid filing petition relief Chapter 11 U.S. Bankruptcy Code (a Chapter 11 filing), Labor Agreements ratified unions' memberships. At time filing Form&nbsp;10-K, unions put Labor Agreements ratification vote. It anticipated official results voting formally announced April&nbsp;15, 2003. A group pilots filed lawsuit April&nbsp;14, 2003 contesting union ratification process. The U.S. District Court Fort Worth, Texas denied request temporary restraining order. Failure unions ratify Labor Agreement lead Company initiate Chapter&nbsp;11 filing. The results operations, cash flows net assets Sabre Holdings Corporation (Sabre) 2000 reflected consolidated financial statements discontinued operations. When flights permitted resume, passenger traffic yields Company's flights significantly lower prior attacks. As result, Company reduced operating schedule approximately 80&nbsp;percent schedule flew prior September&nbsp;11, 2001. In addition, result schedule reduction sharp fall passenger traffic, Company eliminated approximately 20,000 jobs. </FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On September&nbsp;22, 2001, President Bush signed law Air Transportation Safety System Stabilization Act (the Act). SIZE=2><B>4. Goodwill Other Intangible Assets </B></FONT></P> <P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective January&nbsp;1, 2002, Company adopted Statement Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;142, "Goodwill Other Intangible Assets" (SFAS&nbsp;142). SFAS&nbsp;142 requires Company test goodwill indefinite-lived intangible assets (for AMR, route acquisition costs) impairment amortize them. During quarter 2002, Company completed impairment analysis route acquisition costs accordance SFAS&nbsp;142. The analysis result impairment charge. During quarter 2002, Company completed impairment analysis related $1.4&nbsp;billion goodwill determined Company's entire goodwill balance impaired. In arriving conclusion, Company's net book determined excess Company's fair January&nbsp;1, 2002, AMR reporting unit purposes fair determination. The Company determined fair January&nbsp;1, 2002, valuation methods, ultimately market capitalization primary indicator fair value. As result, Company recorded one-time, non-cash charge, effective January&nbsp;1, 2002, $988&nbsp;million ($6.35 share, net tax benefit $363&nbsp;million) write-off AMR's goodwill. The tax benefit $363&nbsp;million differed amount computed statutory federal income tax rate due portion AMR's goodwill deductible federal tax purposes. The charge write-off AMR's goodwill nonoperational nature reflected cumulative effect accounting change consolidated statements operations. </FONT></P> <P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>62</FONT></P> <HR NOSHADE> <!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=63,EFW="2108197",CP="AMR CORP.",DN="1",CHK=237507,FOLIO='62',FILE='DISK014:[03DFW9.03DFW1349]FI1349B.;6',USER='LHOUSE',CD='14-APR-2003;20:17' --> <A NAME="page_fi1349_1_63"> </A> <P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4. <u>Annual Meetings</u>.&#160; An annual meeting stockholders elect directors action matters properly meeting held Wednesday May year, day, time place, State Delaware, board directors chairman board time time fix.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any stockholder wishing bring matter annual meeting notify secretary corporation fact sixty ninety days date meeting.&#160; Such notice writing set business proposed brought meeting, identify stockholder disclose stockholder&#146;s interest proposed business.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" December 2012.</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in Corporation (the &#147;Company&#148;) retain reward employees Company Subsidiaries Affiliates, strengthen mutuality interests employees Company&#146;s shareholders, offering employees equity-based incentives Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Affiliate&#148; means entity Company Subsidiaries designated Board participating employer Plan, provided Company directly indirectly owns twenty percent (20%) combined voting power classes stock entity twenty percent (20%) ownership interests entity.</font></h2> <h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Cause&#148; means felony conviction participant failure participant contest prosecution felony, participant&#146;s willful misconduct dishonesty, directly materially harmful business reputation Company Subsidiary Affiliate.</font></h2> <h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" pursuant terms Plan, officers key employees eligible Section&nbsp;4: (i) Stock Options; (ii)&nbsp;Restricted Stock; and/or (iii)&nbsp;Deferred Stock (collectively, &#147;Awards&#148; singularly, &#147;Award&#148;).</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in </font><u><font face="Times New Roman">Termination Option.</font></u><font face="Times New Roman">&#160; This option terminate longer exercised (i) Optionee ceases employee Corporation Subsidiaries Affiliates; (ii) Optionee employee Subsidiary wholly owned, directly indirectly, Corporation; (iii) Optionee takes leave absence reinstatement rights, agreed writing Corporation Optionee; that</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>If Optionee&#146;s employment Corporation (and Subsidiary Affiliate) involuntarily terminated Corporation Subsidiary Affiliate (as case be) Cause, option exercised, extent exercisable time termination, period months date termination employment stated term option, whichever period shorter; and</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; affiliates AMR Corporation (&#147;AMR&#148; &#147;the Corporation&#148;) achieve highest level individual performance meet exceed goals contribute success Corporation.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in Airlines Employee Profit Sharing Plan (&#147;Plan&#148;) provide participating employees sense commitment to, direct financial interest in, success American Airlines, Inc.</font></p> <p align="left" .0001pt;text-align:left;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Allocation Individual Awards</font></u></p> <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Chairman CEO American, consultation COO, executive senior vice presidents American, determine awards non-officer eligible employees based eligible employee&#146;s performance.&#160; Unless determined Chairman, award Plan non-officer eligible employee, combined award Plan year award incentive compensation, commission, profit sharing bonus compensation plan, exceed 100% eligible employee&#146;s base salary.</font></p> <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" Chairman CEO American, determine awards officers American, including Named Executive Officers.&#160; The awards officers (other Named Executive Officers) equal Target Award, minus adjustments individual performance.&#160; To extent award Named Executive Officer includes partial payment relating Measure (other Net Income), partial payment paid general operating funds American.&#160;&#160;&#160; An award Plan officer exceed amount set Section 11 LTIP.</font></p> <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The aggregate awards paid hereunder exceed lesser of: (2.0 times Fund Aggregate Target Awards) (50% total base salaries eligible participants Plan).&#160;&#160;&#160; In discretion Committee, Fund fully distributed.</font></p> <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in purposes Section&nbsp;15, Executive deemed ceased employee Company subsidiary reason transfer Executive&#146;s employment Company subsidiary, subsidiaries.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" </font><u>Counterparts</u>.&#160; This Agreement executed counterparts, deemed original constitute agreement.</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Additionally, receive payment $55,263 cash equivalent 4.5 weeks vacation.&#160; This paid May 31, 2002.&#160; The 7.5 days vacation accrued 2003 paid June 28, 2002 amount $18,421.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Travel</font></b></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At retirement, issued retiree A2 travel privileges spouse, lifetime Admirals Club membership, UATP card personal travel AA, TWA, American Eagle.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Travel purchased UATP card imputed income.&#160; In January year Company send 1099-MISC reflects &#147;income&#148; travel purchased prior year.&#160; Along 1099-MISC American send check pay taxes travel.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Additionally, participate activities American&#146;s behalf, American reimburse expenses: Embry-Riddle, Wings Club, CRAF, GWU Advisory, MITRE, Conquistadors, government-related activities (including, limited to, FAA, DOT, Homeland Security).</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All travel covered current future policies American&#146;s&#160; Employee Travel Program including TRIP Book subsequent revisions.&#160; By signing Agreement, acknowledge understand agree American&#146;s policy prohibits retaining travel privileges work competitor defined fact sheet comply rules governing Employee Travel Program.</font></p> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p> <div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> <hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"> </font></div> <font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> <!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=2,EFW="2108197",CP="AMR CORP.",DN="18",CHK=616087,FOLIO='2',FILE="DISK020:[03DFW0.03DFW1350.EDGAR]EX10-56_1350.CHC",USER="LHOUSE",CD='Apr 12 00:31 2003' --> <br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;"> </font> <p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>This agreement constitute admission kind American, simply accommodation offers extra benefits entitled return agreeing abiding document.&#160; understand agree comply material term condition agreement, automatically forfeit extra benefits.&#160; Gunn (&#147;Consultant&#148;) American Airlines, Inc., Delaware corporation (the &#147;Company&#148;) 17<sup>th</sup> day September, 2002.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">WHEREAS, Consultant capable performing services Company desires Consultant perform services behalf.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOW, THEREFORE, consideration mutual agreements contained herein, good valuable consideration, receipt sufficiency acknowledged, Company Consultant agree follows:</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; invalidate entire Agreement.&#160; Such provision deemed modified extent render valid enforceable, modification render valid enforceable, Agreement construed provision.</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in Consultant reasonable vacation time (not exceed periods business days each) Term does, Term extended commensurately additional compensation.&#160; For Services, Consultant paid monthly fee advance $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.&#160;&#160; name] (&#147;Officer&#148;) American Airlines, Inc., Delaware corporation (the &#147;Corporation&#148;).</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" approved payment Cash Retention Bonus (as defined Agreement) officers Corporation, including Officer, consideration Officer&#146;s continued employment Corporation.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOW, THEREFORE, good valuable consideration, receipt sufficiency acknowledged, Corporation Officer agree follows:</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>Cash Retention Bonus</u>. In consideration Officer remaining employee Corporation March 1, 2002, including January 31, 2005 (the &#147;Retention Period&#148;), Corporation pay Officer Cash Retention Bonus.&#160; The Cash Retention Bonus detailed Schedule A, attached to, made part of, Agreement.&#160; Payment Cash Retention Bonus made accordance Sections 2, 3, 4, applicable, Agreement.</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>Payment</u>.&#160;&#160; Provided Officer meets requirements Section 3(a) Agreement, Cash Retention Bonus paid Officer follows: (a) 50% January 30, 2004 (the &#147;First Payment&#148;), (b) 50% January 31, 2005 (the &#147;Second Payment&#148;).&#160; Each January 30, 2004, January 31, 2005, &#147;Payment Date&#148;.</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>Requirements Payment</u>.</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" applicable Payment Date.</p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>For purposes Agreement, officer Corporation Officer:&#160; duly elected Board Directors Corporation; active payroll Corporation Payment Date; and, management leave type whatsoever.</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p Retention Bonus (less amount bonus previously paid) paid date established Board Directors Corporation.</p> <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>Elective Deferrals</u>.&#160;&#160; The Officer elect defer receipt First Payment and/or Second Payment pursuant AMR Corporation Executive Deferral Plan (or successor).</p> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font laws State Texas govern Agreement.&#160; The Corporation Officer submits exclusive jurisdiction state court Tarrant County, Texas, United States District Court Northern District Texas (Fort Worth agrees Corporation withhold applicable taxes payment made Agreement.</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p </font><u>Average Incentive Compensation</u>.&#160; An amount calculated follows:</p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <h3 style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The sum Participant&#146;s highest annual Incentive Compensation awards (or sum awards Participant fewer awards) paid Participant time period beginning January 1, 1985, ending occur of:</h3> <h4 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></h4> <h4 style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the Participant&#146;s actual retirement Base Defined Benefit Plan, $uper $aver Participant participating Base Defined Benefit Plan,</h4> <h4 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></h4> <h4 style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b> <h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">TRUST AGREEMENT</font></b></h1> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">UNDER</font></b></p> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SUPPLEMENTAL EXECUTIVE RETIREMENT PROGRAM</font></b></p> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR OFFICERS AIRLINES, INC.</font></b></p> <p AGREEMENT (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) made entered effective 14th day October, 2002 (the &#147;Effective Date&#148;), AIRLINES, INC. (the &#147;Corporation&#148;), corporation organized existing laws State Delaware, WACHOVIA BANK, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION (the &#147;Trustee&#148;), national association organized existing laws United States, individuals constituting Committee Section 10.1 (the &#147;Committee&#148;).</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">RECITALS</font></b></h1> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">WHEREAS, </font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">in January 1985, Board Directors Corporation established Supplemental Executive Retirement Program Officers American Airlines, Inc., subsequently amended (the &#147;Plan&#148;), copy attached hereto Exhibit A made part Agreement purposes, purpose paying retirement benefits officers American Airlines, Inc. and</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">WHEREAS, </font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the Corporation seeks establish irrevocable trust fund retirement benefits Participants Plan; align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="ArticleV"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ARTICLE V</font></b></a></p> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ACTUARY</font></b></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><a name="Section5_1_"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section 5.1</font></u></a><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Determination Corporation&#146;s Fund Contributions Actuary</u></font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; The Actuary calculate time time amount contributions estimates made Fund Corporation purpose accumulate funds provide benefits Plan; <u>provided</u>, <u>however</u> that, pursuant Section 4.1 hereof, Committee determine, sole absolute discretion, whether, extent, Corporation required make contributions Fund.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <a name="Section5_2"><u>Section 5.2</u></a>.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Resignation/Removal Actuary</u></font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; The Actuary resign time delivery written notice resignation Corporation.&#160; Such resignation effect future date notice resignation, date earlier date ninety (90) days day notice received.&#160; The Actuary removed Corporation time delivery written notice removal Actuary.&#160; Such removal effect future date notice removal, date earlier date sixty (60) days day notice received, earlier date agreed Actuary Corporation.&#160; Notwithstanding foregoing, event resignation removal effective successor Actuary appointed resignation removal.&#160; Upon Corporation&#146;s receipt notice resignation removal, Corporation appoint successor Actuary, written instrument, serve commencing effective date Actuary&#146;s resignation removal.&#160; If successor appointed Corporation sixty (60) days issuance notice Actuary&#146;s resignation removal, Committee appoint successor Actuary.</font></p> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="ArticleVi"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ARTICLE VI</font></b></a></h1> <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">INVESTMENTS TRUSTEE</font></b></p> <p Trustee.&#160; The sole responsibilities, powers duties Trustee respect Trust Fund set Agreement.&#160; The Trustee directed trustee only, discretionary authority responsibility, respect Fund extent discretion investment guidelines provided writing Committee.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p assuming appointment Investment Manager remains effect notified Committee writing.&#160; With respect assets Investment Manager investment responsibility, Investment Manager possess investment powers responsibilities granted Committee hereunder, Trustee invest reinvest assets pursuant direction </font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New notify Trustee termination, appoint successor Investment Manager manner provided Section 6.4.&#160; Such successor Investment Manager thereafter, appointment terminated, deemed Investment Manager purposes Agreement.&#160; In event Committee exist, Trustee terminate Investment Manager affiliate Trustee immediately appoint affiliate, Evergreen Investments, Investment Manager.</font></p> <p hours.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt entitled compensation fees services Agreement agreed time time Corporation.&#160; Likewise, Corporation reimburse Trustee </font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" Delaware.&#160; All questions pertaining validity construction Agreement acts transactions parties hereto respective successors determined accordance laws State Texas, matters governed Federal law.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';margin:0in 0in create, construed interpreted create, additional obligations part Corporation retain person employ interfere Corporation discharge employee.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font Corporation Trustee, respectively, exercisable by, respective successors assigns Corporation Trustee.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; Should provision Agreement determined court competent jurisdiction unlawful unenforceable, determination adversely affect remaining provisions Agreement, make impossible maintenance operation Trust intended purposes.&#160; To extent provision Agreement determined unlawful unenforceable, Agreement construed carried fullest extent lawful enforceable manner.</font></p> <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';margin:0in 0in
